1.description: Introduction to the objectives of the UV-spectrophotometer lab.
1.directions: In this lab, you will learn how to use a UV-spectrophotometer to measure the absorbance of various solutions and create a calibration curve.
1.user_instructions: Click the 'Next' button to proceed to the next step.

2.description: Setting up the spectrophotometer by adjusting its initial settings.
2.directions: Adjust the value of the spectrophotometer by typing the desired wavelength number.
2.user_instructions: Use the number pad to input the wavelength value.

mistakes.correctAnswer: Specify the correct wavelength, e.g., 280 nm

3.description: Taking the appropriate cuvette from the cabinet.
3.directions: Navigate to the inventory and select the correct cuvette from the cabinet.
3.user_instructions: Click on the cabinet and choose the right cuvette.

mistakes.correctAnswer: Correct cuvette type, e.g., quartz cuvette for UV measurements

4.description: Cleaning the cuvette by rinsing it with distilled water.
4.directions: Rinse the cuvette thoroughly with distilled water to remove any contaminants.
4.user_instructions: Use the water tap to rinse the cuvette.

5.stepTitle: Washing the Cuvette with Sample Solution
5.description: Cleaning the cuvette with the solution to be measured.
5.directions: Rinse the cuvette with the sample solution to ensure it's free from water residues.
5.user_instructions: Use the sample bottle to rinse the cuvette.

6.description: Filling the cuvette to 2/3 of its capacity with the sample solution.
6.directions: Fill the cuvette to the 2/3 mark with the solution.
6.user_instructions: Use the measuring lines on the cuvette to ensure accurate filling.

7.description: Ensuring the cuvette is clean by wiping its surface.
7.directions: Use a wiping paper to clean the outer surface of the cuvette by rotating it 90Â° and wiping each side.
7.user_instructions: Click and drag the wiping paper around the cuvette.

8.description: Securing the cuvette by attaching its cap.
8.directions: Place the cap on the cuvette to prevent any spillage during measurement.
8.user_instructions: Click on the cap and attach it to the cuvette.

9.stepTitle: Inserting the Cuvette into the Spectrophotometer
9.description: Placing the prepared cuvette into the spectrophotometer.
9.directions: Now that we have seen how to prepare a cuvette, let's identify which cuvette sample to put into the spectrophotometer.
9.user_instructions: Select which cuvette sample to put into the machine.

10.stepTitle: Inserting the Cuvette into the Spectrophotometer
10.description: Placing the prepared cuvette into the spectrophotometer.
10.directions: Insert the blank solution cuvette into the spectrophotometer, ensuring the clear side is aligned correctly for light passage. The blank solution will perform the calibration to cancel out background signals.
10.user_instructions: Drag and drop the cuvette into the spectrophotometer slot.

mistakes.correctAnswer: Clear side facing the light source

11.description: Measuring the absorbance of different sample solutions.
11.directions: Now close the chamber, start the measurement process, and await for the results. Then repeat for all the other solutions.
11.user_instructions: Click on the chamber door to close it and start the measurement process.

mistakes.correctAnswer: Ensure the reading matches the display accurately

12.description: Plotting the calibration curve based on absorbance readings.
12.directions: We will use the recorded absorbance values to plot a calibration curve. First, identify the x and y axis parameters.
12.user_instructions: Input the absorbance and concentration values into the answer box.

13.description: Interpreting the calibration curve to determine sample concentrations.
13.directions: Use the calibration curve to determine the concentrations of unknown samples based on their absorbance.
13.user_instructions: Complete the quiz dialog using the calibration curve graph.

14.directions: Congratulations! You have successfully completed the UV-spectrophotometer lab. Review your results and ensure all data is recorded accurately.
